{code}

Steps to Repro:

{code}
Create Hbase Table:
========================
create 'hbase_avro_table', 'test_col_fam', 'test_col'

Create Hive Table:
=========================
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE test_hbase_avro2
ROW FORMAT SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseSerDe'
STORED BY 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.hbase.HBaseStorageHandler'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
"hbase.columns.mapping" = ":key,test_col_fam:test_col",
"test_col_fam.test_col.serialization.type" = "avro",
"test_col_fam.test_col.avro.schema.url" = "hdfs://rpathak-h1.openstacklocal:8020/user/hive/schema.avsc")
TBLPROPERTIES (
"hbase.table.name" = "hbase_avro_table",
"hbase.mapred.output.outputtable" = "hbase_avro_table",
"hbase.struct.autogenerate"="true",
"avro.schema.literal"='{
"type": "record",
"name": "test_hbase_avro",
"fields": [
{ "name":"test_col", "type":"string"}
]
}');
{code}

The same query works with Hive 1.2.1
fields.summary: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - HBASE-backed tables with Avro schema in Hive2

comments.body:
The change looks good. Can you also add a UT ? (a .q one similar to other hbase tests in hive?)
For users without a fix, can they workaround it by adding comments ?
[~thejas] will look at the tests too add one. Yeh looks like if there are comments then users should be able to get around this issue.

GitHub user anishek opened a pull request:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/283

    HIVE-17829: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - HBASE-backed tables with Avro schema in Hive2

    

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

    $ git pull https://github.com/anishek/hive HIVE-17829

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

    https://github.com/apache/hive/pull/283.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

    This closes #283
    
----
commit 5c0b586af9323a2095c24507665064a32252834b
Author: Anishek Agarwal <anishek@...>
Date:   2017-12-20T08:57:43Z

    HIVE-17829: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - HBASE-backed tables with Avro schema in Hive2

----
reattaching the same patch again so that hive build system picks up the change and runs tests.
